member.name: T:Stateless.StateMachine`2
member.summary: Models behaviour as transitions between a finite set of states.
member.typeparam: The type used to represent the states.
The type used to represent the triggers that cause state transitions.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.#ctor(System.Func{`0},System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Construct a state machine with external state storage.
member.param: A function that will be called to read the current state value.
An action that will be called to write new state values.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Construct a state machine.
member.param: The initial state.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.Configure(`0)
member.summary: Begin configuration of the entry/exit actions and allowed transitions when the state machine is in a particular state.
member.param: The state to configure.
member.returns: A configuration object through which the state can be configured.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.Fire(`1)
member.summary: Transition from the current state via the specified trigger. The target state is determined by the configuration of the current state. Actions associated with leaving the current state and entering the new one will be invoked.
member.param: The trigger to fire.
member.exception: The current state does not allow the trigger to be fired.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.Fire``1(Stateless.StateMachine{`0,`1}.TriggerWithParameters{``0},``0)
member.summary: Transition from the current state via the specified trigger. The target state is determined by the configuration of the current state. Actions associated with leaving the current state and entering the new one will be invoked.
member.typeparam: Type of the first trigger argument.
member.param: The trigger to fire.
The first argument.
member.exception: The current state does not allow the trigger to be fired.

member.summary: Transition from the current state via the specified trigger. The target state is determined by the configuration of the current state. Actions associated with leaving the current state and entering the new one will be invoked.
member.typeparam: Type of the first trigger argument.
Type of the second trigger argument.
member.param: The first argument.
The second argument.
The trigger to fire.
member.exception: The current state does not allow the trigger to be fired.

Type of the second trigger argument.
Type of the third trigger argument.
member.param: The first argument.
The second argument.

The trigger to fire.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.OnUnhandledTrigger(System.Action{`0,`1})
member.summary: Override the default behaviour of throwing an exception when an unhandled trigger is fired.
member.param: An action to call when an unhandled trigger is fired.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.IsInState(`0)
member.summary: Determine if the state machine is in the supplied state.
member.param: The state to test for.
member.returns: True if the current state is equal to, or a substate of, the supplied state.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.CanFire(`1)
member.summary: Returns true if can be fired in the current state.
member.param: Trigger to test.
member.returns: True if the trigger can be fired, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.ToString
member.summary: A human-readable representation of the state machine.
member.returns: A description of the current state and permitted triggers.

member.summary: Specify the arguments that must be supplied when a specific trigger is fired.
member.typeparam: Type of the first trigger argument.
member.param: The underlying trigger value.
member.returns: An object that can be passed to the Fire() method in order to fire the parameterised trigger.

member.summary: The configuration for a single state value.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.Permit(`1,`0)
member.summary: Accept the specified trigger and transition to the destination state.
member.param: The accepted trigger.
The state that the trigger will cause a transition to.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.PermitIf(`1,`0,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Accept the specified trigger and transition to the destination state.
member.param: The accepted trigger.
The state that the trigger will cause a transition to.
Function that must return true in order for the trigger to be accepted.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.PermitReentry(`1)
member.summary: Accept the specified trigger, execute exit actions and re-execute entry actions. Reentry behaves as though the configured state transitions to an identical sibling state.
member.param: The accepted trigger.
member.remarks: Applies to the current state only. Will not re-execute superstate actions, or cause actions to execute transitioning between super- and sub-states.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.PermitReentryIf(`1,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Accept the specified trigger, execute exit actions and re-execute entry actions. Reentry behaves as though the configured state transitions to an identical sibling state.
member.param: The accepted trigger.
Function that must return true in order for the trigger to be accepted.
member.remarks: Applies to the current state only. Will not re-execute superstate actions, or cause actions to execute transitioning between super- and sub-states.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.Ignore(`1)
member.summary: Ignore the specified trigger when in the configured state.
member.param: The trigger to ignore.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.IgnoreIf(`1,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Ignore the specified trigger when in the configured state, if the guard returns true..
member.param: The trigger to ignore.
Function that must return true in order for the trigger to be ignored.

member.name: M:Stateless.StateMachine`2.StateConfiguration.SubstateOf(`0)
member.summary: Sets the superstate that the configured state is a substate of.
member.remarks: Substates inherit the allowed transitions of their superstate. When entering directly into a substate from outside of the superstate, entry actions for the superstate are executed. Likewise when leaving from the substate to outside the supserstate, exit actions for the superstate will execute.
member.param: The superstate.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Stateless.StateConfigurationResources.SelfTransitionsEitherIgnoredOrReentrant
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Permit() (and PermitIf()) require that the destination state is not equal to the source state. To accept a trigger without changing state, use either Ignore() or PermitReentry()..
